trans-unit.source: This page provides a comprehensive list of every document written about the various application-related features in Azure Active Directory (Azure AD).
trans-unit.target: This page provides a comprehensive list of every document written about the various application-related features in Azure Active Directory (Azure AD).

trans-unit.source: There is a brief introduction to each major feature area, as well as guidance on which articles to read depending on what information you're looking for.
trans-unit.target: There is a brief introduction to each major feature area, as well as guidance on which articles to read depending on what information you're looking for.

trans-unit.source: Federated Single Sign-On: Sign into many apps using one identity
trans-unit.target: Federated Single Sign-On: Sign into many apps using one identity

trans-unit.source: Single sign-on allows users to access a variety of apps and services using only one set of credentials.
trans-unit.target: Single sign-on allows users to access a variety of apps and services using only one set of credentials.

trans-unit.source: Federation is one method through which you can enable single sign-on.
trans-unit.target: Federation is one method through which you can enable single sign-on.

trans-unit.source: When users attempt to sign into federated apps, they will get redirected to their organization's official sign-in page rendered by Azure Active Directory, and are then redirected back to the app upon successful authentication.
trans-unit.target: When users attempt to sign into federated apps, they will get redirected to their organization's official sign-in page rendered by Azure Active Directory, and are then redirected back to the app upon successful authentication.

trans-unit.source: Federated single sign-on is available for all editions of Azure AD for up to ten apps per user.
trans-unit.target: Federated single sign-on is available for all editions of Azure AD for up to ten apps per user.

trans-unit.source: [Azure AD Premium](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/active-directory/) supports unlimited applications.
trans-unit.target: [Azure AD Premium](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/active-directory/) supports unlimited applications.

trans-unit.source: If your organization has [Azure AD Basic](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/active-directory/) or [Azure AD Premium](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/active-directory/), then you can [use groups to assign access to federated applications](#how-to-manage-who-has-access-to-which-apps).
trans-unit.target: If your organization has [Azure AD Basic](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/active-directory/) or [Azure AD Premium](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/active-directory/), then you can [use groups to assign access to federated applications](#how-to-manage-who-has-access-to-which-apps).

trans-unit.source: Password-Based Single Sign-On: Account sharing and SSO for non-federated apps
trans-unit.target: Password-Based Single Sign-On: Account sharing and SSO for non-federated apps

trans-unit.source: To enable single sign-on to applications that don't support federation, Azure AD offers password management features that can securely store passwords to SaaS apps and automatically sign users into those apps.
trans-unit.target: To enable single sign-on to applications that don't support federation, Azure AD offers password management features that can securely store passwords to SaaS apps and automatically sign users into those apps.

trans-unit.source: You can easily distribute credentials for newly created accounts and share team accounts with multiple people.
trans-unit.target: You can easily distribute credentials for newly created accounts and share team accounts with multiple people.

trans-unit.source: Users don't necessarily need to know the credentials to the accounts that they're given access to.
trans-unit.target: Users don't necessarily need to know the credentials to the accounts that they're given access to.

trans-unit.source: [Azure AD Premium](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/active-directory/) supports unlimited applications.
trans-unit.target: [Azure AD Premium](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/active-directory/) supports unlimited applications.

trans-unit.source: If your organization has [Azure AD Basic](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/active-directory/) or [Azure AD Premium](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/active-directory/), then you can [use groups to assign access to applications](#how-to-manage-who-has-access-to-which-apps).
trans-unit.target: If your organization has [Azure AD Basic](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/active-directory/) or [Azure AD Premium](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/active-directory/), then you can [use groups to assign access to applications](#how-to-manage-who-has-access-to-which-apps).

trans-unit.source: App Proxy: Single sign-on and remote access to on-premises applications
trans-unit.target: App Proxy: Single sign-on and remote access to on-premises applications

trans-unit.source: If you have applications in your private network that need to be accessed by users and devices outside the network, then you can use Azure AD Application Proxy to enable secure, remote access to those apps.
trans-unit.target: If you have applications in your private network that need to be accessed by users and devices outside the network, then you can use Azure AD Application Proxy to enable secure, remote access to those apps.

trans-unit.source: [Azure AD Premium](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/active-directory/) supports unlimited applications.
trans-unit.target: [Azure AD Premium](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/active-directory/) supports unlimited applications.

trans-unit.source: If your organization has [Azure AD Basic](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/active-directory/) or [Azure AD Premium](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/active-directory/), then you can [use groups to assign access to applications](#how-to-manage-who-has-access-to-which-apps).
trans-unit.target: If your organization has [Azure AD Basic](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/active-directory/) or [Azure AD Premium](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/active-directory/), then you can [use groups to assign access to applications](#how-to-manage-who-has-access-to-which-apps).

trans-unit.source: You may also be interested in [Azure AD Domain Services](../active-directory-domain-services/active-directory-ds-overview.md), which allows you to migrate your on-premises applications to Azure while still satisfying the identity needs of those applications.
trans-unit.target: You may also be interested in [Azure AD Domain Services](../active-directory-domain-services/active-directory-ds-overview.md), which allows you to migrate your on-premises applications to Azure while still satisfying the identity needs of those applications.

trans-unit.source: Enabling single sign-on between Azure AD and on-premises AD
trans-unit.target: Enabling single sign-on between Azure AD and on-premises AD

trans-unit.source: If your organization maintains a Windows Server Active Directory on premises along with your Azure Active Directory in the cloud, then you will likely want to enable single sign-on between these two systems.
trans-unit.target: If your organization maintains a Windows Server Active Directory on premises along with your Azure Active Directory in the cloud, then you will likely want to enable single sign-on between these two systems.

trans-unit.source: Azure AD Connect (the tool that integrates these two systems together) provides multiple options for setting up single sign-on: establish federation with ADFS or another federation provider, or enable password synchronization.
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Connect (the tool that integrates these two systems together) provides multiple options for setting up single sign-on: establish federation with ADFS or another federation provider, or enable password synchronization.

trans-unit.target: Password Writeback to on-prem AD is an [Azure AD Premium](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/active-directory/) feature.

trans-unit.source: Conditional Access: Enforce additional security requirements for high-risk apps
trans-unit.target: Conditional Access: Enforce additional security requirements for high-risk apps

trans-unit.source: Once you set up single sign-on to your apps and resources, you can then further secure sensitive applications by enforcing specific security requirements on every sign-in to that app.
trans-unit.target: Once you set up single sign-on to your apps and resources, you can then further secure sensitive applications by enforcing specific security requirements on every sign-in to that app.

trans-unit.source: For instance, you can use Azure AD to demand that all access to a particular app always require multi-factor authentication, regardless of whether or not that app innately supports that functionality.
trans-unit.target: For instance, you can use Azure AD to demand that all access to a particular app always require multi-factor authentication, regardless of whether or not that app innately supports that functionality.

trans-unit.source: Another common example of conditional access is to require that users be connected to the organization's trusted network in order to access a particularly sensitive application.
trans-unit.target: Another common example of conditional access is to require that users be connected to the organization's trusted network in order to access a particularly sensitive application.

trans-unit.source: Cloud App Discovery: Find which SaaS apps are being used in your organization
trans-unit.target: Cloud App Discovery: Find which SaaS apps are being used in your organization

trans-unit.source: Cloud App Discovery helps IT departments learn which SaaS apps are being used throughout the organization.
trans-unit.target: Cloud App Discovery helps IT departments learn which SaaS apps are being used throughout the organization.

trans-unit.source: It can measure app usage and popularity so that IT can determine which apps will benefit the most from being brought under IT control and being integrated with Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: It can measure app usage and popularity so that IT can determine which apps will benefit the most from being brought under IT control and being integrated with Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: Automated user provisioning is available for all editions of Azure AD for up to ten apps per user.
trans-unit.target: Automated user provisioning is available for all editions of Azure AD for up to ten apps per user.

trans-unit.source: [Azure AD Premium](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/active-directory/) supports unlimited applications.
trans-unit.target: [Azure AD Premium](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/active-directory/) supports unlimited applications.

trans-unit.source: If your organization has [Azure AD Basic](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/active-directory/) or [Azure AD Premium](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/active-directory/), then you can [use groups to manage which users get provisioned](#how-to-manage-who-has-access-to-which-apps).
trans-unit.target: If your organization has [Azure AD Basic](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/active-directory/) or [Azure AD Premium](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/active-directory/), then you can [use groups to manage which users get provisioned](#how-to-manage-who-has-access-to-which-apps).

trans-unit.source: Building applications that integrate with Azure AD
trans-unit.target: Building applications that integrate with Azure AD

trans-unit.source: If your organization is developing or maintaining line-of-business (LoB) applications, or if you're an app developer with customers who use Azure Active Directory, the following tutorials will help you integrate your applications with Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: If your organization is developing or maintaining line-of-business (LoB) applications, or if you're an app developer with customers who use Azure Active Directory, the following tutorials will help you integrate your applications with Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: If you're developing consumer-facing applications, you may be interested in using [Azure Active Directory B2C](https://azure.microsoft.com/services/active-directory-b2c/) so that you don't have to develop your own identity system to manage your users.
trans-unit.target: If you're developing consumer-facing applications, you may be interested in using [Azure Active Directory B2C](https://azure.microsoft.com/services/active-directory-b2c/) so that you don't have to develop your own identity system to manage your users.

trans-unit.source: [Learn more](../active-directory-b2c/active-directory-b2c-overview.md).
trans-unit.target: [Learn more](../active-directory-b2c/active-directory-b2c-overview.md).

trans-unit.source: Managing Access to Applications
trans-unit.target: Managing Access to Applications

trans-unit.source: Using groups and self-service to manage who has access to which apps
trans-unit.target: Using groups and self-service to manage who has access to which apps

trans-unit.source: To help you manage who should have access to which resources, Azure Active Directory allows you to set assignments and permissions at scale using groups.
trans-unit.target: To help you manage who should have access to which resources, Azure Active Directory allows you to set assignments and permissions at scale using groups.

trans-unit.source: IT may choose to enable self-service features so that users can simply request permission when they need it.
trans-unit.target: IT may choose to enable self-service features so that users can simply request permission when they need it.

trans-unit.target: Group-based application access management is available for [Azure AD Basic](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/active-directory/) and [Azure AD Premium](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/active-directory/).

trans-unit.source: Self-service group management, self-service application management, and dynamic groups are [Azure AD Premium](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/active-directory/) features.
trans-unit.target: Self-service group management, self-service application management, and dynamic groups are [Azure AD Premium](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/active-directory/) features.

trans-unit.source: B2B Collaboration: Enable partner access to applications
trans-unit.target: B2B Collaboration: Enable partner access to applications

trans-unit.source: If your business has partnered with other companies, it's likely that you need to manage partner access to your corporate applications.
trans-unit.target: If your business has partnered with other companies, it's likely that you need to manage partner access to your corporate applications.

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory B2B Collaboration provides an easy and secure way to share your apps with partners.
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory B2B Collaboration provides an easy and secure way to share your apps with partners.

trans-unit.source: This feature is currently in preview.
trans-unit.target: This feature is currently in preview.

trans-unit.source: Access Panel: A portal for accessing apps and self-service features
trans-unit.target: Access Panel: A portal for accessing apps and self-service features

trans-unit.source: The Azure AD Access Panel is where end-users can launch their apps and access the self-service features that allow them to manage their apps and group memberships.
trans-unit.target: The Azure AD Access Panel is where end-users can launch their apps and access the self-service features that allow them to manage their apps and group memberships.

trans-unit.source: In addition to the Access Panel, other options for accessing SSO-enabled apps are included in the list below.
trans-unit.target: In addition to the Access Panel, other options for accessing SSO-enabled apps are included in the list below.

trans-unit.source: Reports: Easily audit app access changes and monitor sign-ins to apps
trans-unit.target: Reports: Easily audit app access changes and monitor sign-ins to apps

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory provides several reports and alerts to help you monitor your organization's access to applications.
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory provides several reports and alerts to help you monitor your organization's access to applications.

trans-unit.source: You can receive alerts for anomalous sign-ins to your apps, and you can track when and why a users' access to an application has changed.
trans-unit.target: You can receive alerts for anomalous sign-ins to your apps, and you can track when and why a users' access to an application has changed.
